summary: Held in the heart of the Colorado Rockies, The Great Divide Ultra is a high-altitude trail festival that traverses the scenic rolling meadows and granite formations of Mueller State Park. Runners face a formidable test of endurance across distances ranging from 25K to 100 miles, all while surrounded by sweeping vistas of Pikes Peak.
uniqueFeatures: High-Altitude Environment: The entire course is situated at a punishing elevation between 9,189 and 9,743 feet, requiring runners to contend with significantly thinner air throughout the race.

Dark Divide Night Run: A standout feature of the festival is a dedicated night-start event that allows participants to experience the trails under the stars alongside the 100-mile and 100K competitors.

Looped Support System: The 100-mile course utilizes a repetitive 14.8-mile loop design, which provides exceptional crew access and ensures that runners encounter well-stocked aid stations every 4 to 6 miles.

media.title: MassUltra Roundup: Great Divide Ultra Trail Festival
media.summary: An editorial report detailing the history and growth of the Great Divide Ultra, describing its early-season timing and the unique granite landscape of the Teller County course.
media.contentSummary: A detailed report on New England ultramarunners competing in various western and midwestern races during the weekend of June 6-8. Notable performances include Shae Regan's course-record overall victory at the Malibu Canyon 50K and Johanna Ylanen's female win at the Huron 100. The roundup also covers local participation and top finishers at the San Diego 100, Sawmill Ultra, Silver State Endurance Runs, and Great Divide Ultra Trail Festival.
